subtitle: An adaptation of a traditional Turkish dish with the fragrant aroma of allspice.

method.text: Halve the aubergines lengthways. Leaving a substantial shell, scoop out some of the flesh and reserve.
Sprinkle the insides of the aubergine shells with salt. Put upside down on a plate. Leave for 30 min to drain.

Heat 30 ml of the oil in a saucepan. Fry the onions, pepper and garlic gently for 15 min until soft. Add the drained tomatoes, reserved aubergine flesh, parsley, allspice and seasoning. Simmer gently, uncovered, for 20 min.
Rinse the aubergines well. Pat dry with kitchen paper. Arrange them in a shallow overproof dish. Spoon the tomato filling into each aubergine half.

Mix the remaining oil with the measured water, the sugar and lemon juice and seasoning. Pour around the aubergines. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the filling. Cook in the oven for about an hour until tender.
Serve  hot or cold, sprinkled with pine nuts.

title: Imam bayildi
